title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Power Generation Sector, through Energy Markets Group

description.narrative: This definitional mission (DM) identified and evaluated opportunities in the traditional and renewable power generation sectors in Libya for USTDA funding consideration.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Information and Communication Technology Program, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: The Libya Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) Program consisted of two separate RTMs that introduced public and private sector representatives from Libya to U.S. providers for technology, equipment, and services in the ICT sector and also exposed delegates to regulatory and operational strategies, financing structures and resources, procurement best practices, and executive level training. The RTM Program demonstrated U.S. technologies and operational best practices that will support Libya's effort to modernize and transform the key ICT subsectors of cyber security and data center development.

participating-org.narrative: National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

receiver-org.narrative: National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Natural Gas-Fired Power Generation, through Maritz, LLC

description.narrative: The Libya Natural Gas-Fired Power Generation Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) introduced representatives from Libyan power producers to U.S. providers of technology, equipment, and services that can support efforts to augment and modernize the electricity generation sector in Libya. The RTM focused on natural gas-fired electricity generation and associated power plant modernization projects that will enhance Libya's electricity sector with new natural gas-fired electricity generation capacity and upgrades to existing power plants.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Transportation Safety and Security, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: The Libya Transportation Safety and Security Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) Program consisted of two separate RTMs focused on safety and security in the key Libyan transportation sectors of aviation and maritime ports. The objective of both RTMs was to support efforts to modernize the safety and security practices in the transportation sector in Libya by exposing delegates to U.S. technologies, operational best practices, financing options, and executive level training. Delegates on each RTM traveled to the United States to gain exposure to advanced technologies through site visits and meetings with leading U.S. companies that specialize in safety and security technology, equipment, and systems related to airports and maritime ports.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - DEFINITIONAL MISSION: ICT SECTOR, through Network Dynamics Associates, LLC

description.narrative: This $75,000 Definitional Mission identifies and evaluates opportunities in the ICT sector in Libya for entities and U.S. companies with interest in the ICT sector in Libya that are likely to support economic development as well as promote the use of U.S. goods, services and technologies in the implementation.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - DEFINITIONAL MISSION: TRANSPORTATION SECTOR, through Ascendant Program Services, LLC

description.narrative: This $80,000 Definitional Mission (DM) identifies and evaluates opportunities in the transportation sector in Libya for USTDA funding consideration. The DM Consultant works with the relevant Libyan entities and U.S. companies with interest in the transportation sector in Libya to identify opportunities that are likely to support economic development as well as promote the use of US goods, services and technologies in the implementation.

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - DEFINITIONAL MISSION: POWER GENERATION SECTOR, through Energy Markets Group

description.narrative: This $80,000 Definitional Mission (DM) identifies and evaluates opportunities in the traditional and renewable power generation sectors in Libya for USTDA funding consideration. The DM consultant works with the relevant Libyan entities and U.S. companies with interest in the traditional and renewable power generation sectors in Libya to identify opportunities that are likely to support economic development as well as promote the use of U.S. goods, services and technologies in the implementation.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - TRANSPORTATION SAFETY AND SECURITY RTM PROGRAM, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: The Libya Transportation Safety and Security Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) Program consists of two separate RTMs that are each focused on safety and security in the key Libyan transportation sectors of aviation and maritime ports, respectively. The objective of both RTMs is to support efforts to modernize the safety and security practices in the transportation sector in Libya by exposing delegates to U.S. technologies, operation best practices, financing options, and executive level training. Delegates on each RTM travel to the United States to gain exposure to advanced technologies through site visits and meetings with leading U.S. companies that specialize in safety and security technology, equipment and systems related to airports and maritime ports.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - NATURAL GAS-FIRED POWER GENERATION (RTM), through Maritz, LLC

description.narrative: The Libya Natural Gas-Fired Power Generation Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) introduces representatives from Libyan power producers to U.S. providers of technology, equipment and services that can support efforts to augment and modernize the electricity generation sector in Libya. The RTM focuses on natural gas-fired electricity generation and associated power plant modernization projects that will enhance Libya's electricity sector with new natural gas-fired electricity generation capacity and upgrades to existing inefficient power plants.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - INTERNET EXCHANGE POINTS, through Packet Clearing House

description.narrative: This $80,000 Technical Assistance (TA) activity with Packet Clearing House, Inc, a nonprofit research institute, supports the establishment of Internet Exchange Points (IXPs) in the Libyan cities of Tripoli and Benghazi. The objective of the TA is to reduce the cost and increase the performance and reliability of Internet access in Libya. In addition, the TA would create the nuclei for the formation of a domestic private sector information and communication technology industry.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date
